text: William Joseph Phyle (June 25, 1875 - August 6, 1953), born in Duluth, Minnesota was a pitcher for Major League Baseball's Chicago Orphans (1898–99) and New York Giants (1901) and a third baseman for the St. Louis Cardinals (1906). He pitched a shutout on his Major League debut, in a 9-0 victory over the Washington Senators on September 17, 1898. After his playing career finished, Phyle was an umpire in the Pacific Coast League. ==References== ==Sources== Category:1875 births Category:1953 deaths Category:Sportspeople from Duluth, Minnesota Category:Chicago Orphans players Category:New York Giants (NL) players Category:St. Louis Cardinals players Category:Major League Baseball pitchers Category:Toronto Maple Leafs (International League) players Category:St. Paul Apostles players Category:St. Paul Saints (Western League) players Category:Minneapolis Millers (baseball) players Category:Milwaukee Brewers (minor league) players Category:Memphis Egyptians players Category:Johnstown Johnnies players Category:Kansas City Blues (baseball) players Category:Baseball players from Minnesota Category:Native American sportspeople Category:19th-century baseball players
title: Bill Phyle
